results.title: From Mountain of CCTV Footage, Pay Dirt: 2 Russians Are Named in Spy Poisoning
results.abstract: The poisoning of a former Russian spy led to a landmark test of an investigative technique Britain has pioneered: accumulating mounds of visual data and sifting through it.

results.title: Bombings Target Afghan Wrestling Match and Those Who Rushed to the Scene
results.abstract: At least 20 people were killed and 70 wounded in the blasts in Kabul, including emergency workers and journalists who were reporting live on Afghan television.

org_facet: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

multimedia.caption: An injured boy receiving help outside a hospital in Kabul, Afghanistan, after two bombings at a wrestling training center. The second blast was far larger, and timed to kill emergency workers and journalists.

results.title: U.S. Embassy Bombing Attempt in Cairo Misfires
results.abstract: The bomb, carried in a backpack, exploded prematurely, foiling the attacker’s plot, Egyptian officials said.
results.byline: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and MOHAMED EZZ

results.title: Kolkata Bridge Collapse Leaves at Least One Dead and Several Trapped
results.abstract: The state’s governor told reporters that “the bridge deserved better maintenance” and that there had been previous complaints about the soundness of the structure.

results.title: Brexit Gave Labour Party an Opening. Instead, It Has an Anti-Semitism Crisis.
results.abstract: Britain’s Labour Party is seeking once and for all to end a rift over anti-Semitism. But the infighting has exposed damaging divisions.

results.title: Satellite Images and Shadow Analysis: How The Times Verifies Eyewitness Videos
results.abstract: Visual investigations based on social media posts require a mix of traditional journalistic diligence and cutting-edge internet skills.

results.title: Amazon Hits $1,000,000,000,000 in Value, Following Apple
results.abstract: Apple became the first public company to be worth $1 trillion. Amazon hit the same milestone a month later, but the reasons for the e-commerce titan’s rise are more complicated.

multimedia.caption: Amazon’s founder and chief executive, Jeff Bezos, is richer, by far, than anyone in the modern world.

results.title: Near Everest’s Slopes, a Helicopter Rescue Fraud Preys on Trekkers
results.abstract: The Nepali government says that a wave of fraudulent claims and unneeded evacuations has cost insurance companies millions of dollars this year alone.

results.title: A Top Chinese Official (Not Xi Jinping) Will Visit North Korea
results.abstract: There had been speculation that China’s president would attend national celebrations in Pyongyang this week, but state media said he would send an envoy.
results.byline: By CHOE SANG-HUN and JANE PERLEZ
des_facet: Arms Control and Limitation and Disarmament

multimedia.caption: President Xi Jinping of China, right, with Li Zhanshu in March. Mr. Li, a member of the Politburo Standing Committee, will lead a Chinese delegation to the North Korean capital this week.
